data.title: Polish D2k weapons and add wall explosion
data.body:
Closes #12766.
Closes #12768.

Note: The missile tank and missile turret weapons didn't have explosion sounds in the original, either, but I left them enabled here because... well, there would be almost no weapon explosion sounds otherwise.

Adding to Next milestone because it's fairly uncontroversial polish and easy to review/test.

Some D2k weapons shouldn't have explosion sounds

At least the following weapons should be checked whether they should use either a different, or no explosion sound at all to match the original:

- Bazooka (infantry)
- Rocket (Quad)
- Fremen_S
- grenade (Grenadier)

data.title: [RA] Add/remove official maps 2.
data.body:
Just to note in the interest of the ongoing map contest (ending Feb. 28th) I'm leaving out these maps as candidates for map swap PR's. These can easily be brought forth later after an official playtest has been released.

**Adding:**

- Green Belt (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/19254/
- Snow Off (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/14675
- Ensio Kaivo (3 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/19255/
- Minor Pressure (4 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/19257
- Vihaan Lunta (4 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/19256/

**Removing:**

- Forest Path (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/13032/
- Man to Man (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/12875/

**Alter:**

- Desert Rats (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/17961/
- Dual Cold Front (2 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/19086/

- - - - - - - -

Forest Path will forever ingrain itself as the map showcasing OpenRA on TotalBiscuit's first impression review in 2014. But in all seriousness this map has IMO played out its role even after being heavily revised and balanced in before release2016.0508. Casual or competitive, afaik nobody plays it anymore.

data.title: Missing/incorrect wall explosion in d2k
data.body: Vanilla d2k appears to have a special explosion type for destroyed walls.  Current OpenRA d2k throws shapnel and doesn't show the concrete explosion animation.

data.title: Clean up stale metadata registrations.
Automatically register mod metadata during installation.
data.body:
It is fairly straightforward to make the Windows and Linux installers pre-register the default mod metadata during install (so that they are available for fast-switching without having to be manually launched the first time), and my [utility-registration](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/utility-registration) branch adds this.

This branch isn't mergable in its current state, because writing user-specific files for only the current user from an installer is very bad practice.

Once #10374 has been solved we can switch the metadata files over to the shared data dir and this proof of concept should be mergable as-is.

data.title: Change target location for Mods.Cnc to mods/common
data.body: Closes #12659.

data.title: Move RA chrome yamls to common
data.body: As part of #12554.

data.title: TD Aircraft Changes. SAM fix.
data.body:
Orca:

SelfReloadDelay is now 60 instead of 100.

Damage is 30 instead of 25.

Damage vs none is 45 instead of 50.

Apache:

SelfReloadDelay is now 40 instead of 200.

Reload count is now 2 instead of 10.

Damage vs heavy is now 40 instead of 25.

Movement speed is now 175 instead of 180.

---------

Orca changes were added to be effective armor killers. Currently they lack firepower to make this happen. Increasing their over all damage compensates this while also increasing their reload speed. Reducing the infantry damages helps to keep them from being infantry killers.

Apaches reload is being fixed up. 200 is way to long for their damage focus so enabling a 40 tick at just 2 instead of 10 allows them to burst fire for longer which allows more damage. They still lacked vs armor however so an increase was done to make them effective herassments vs harvesters and APC plays. The movement speed was reduced slightly due to them moving to fast still and catching Orcas and just slight turns.

-----------

SAM:

It now has the correct missile. (I didn't swap it in the original fix. Go me.) -- Switch to Dragon instead of SAMMissile.

Ill do a re-open fix for the SAM on a seperate PR. Closing this for now on discussion relations.

data.title: Unhardcode disableCloak on critical HP (#12741)
data.body:
This PR removes hardcoded uncloaking behavior in Cloak trait, where the unit uncloaks itself when it is in critical HP.
The units that need to uncloak itself on heavy damage can use GrantConditionOnDamageState. (#12741)

YAML files for D2K/CNC/RA/TS has been updated to compensate for this change.

data.body:
Fixes #12756.
Plus some minor other cleanups.

data.title: Merge Mods.RA into Mods.Cnc
D2K - Almost all weapons are blocked by walls
data.body:
In original game only Combat Tank and Devastator bullets were blocked by walls and turrets. On our OpenRA D2K mod, Weapons except Turrets, Siege Tank, Missile Tank, Sonic Tank and Deviator are blocked.

Also looks like Devastator has unnecessarily `Blockable: true` on it.

![](http://imgur.com/4eYZy1H.png)

Clicking where the mouse is will bridge the entire horizontal gap.

data.title: Utility should lint mod sequence definitions
data.body: At the moment it does it only when a map defines custom sequences (see #12744 for reference).

data.title: Support powers should have designated keybind slots
data.body:
Currently support power keybinds are assigned to the powers in the order that they are constructed. For example, if I keybind support power command slot 1, the keybind will be the spy plane if I build an airfield first, and will be an iron curtain if I build that before the airfield.

If I anticipate always building an airfield before the iron curtain the keybind slot for the IC will change based on if Im Ukraine or Russia because of parabombs. Also, it would be handy to have a similar keybinding scheme between Allies and Soviets for players who play both.

Powers should correspond with a specific keybind slot. This will allow players to reduce the amount of keybinds they use and/or be more timely with their support power usage. 

An example from FiveAces on timely support power usage: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak8igonFVDE#t=24m25s

My recommendation would be:

Slot 1: Iron Curtain/Chronosphere

Slot 2: Atomic Bomb

Slot 3: Spy Plane

Slot 4: Paratroopers

Slot 5: Parabombs

Slot 6: Sonar Pulse

data.title: Prevent duplicate upgrades (plugs) to GDI Upgrade Center (Pluggable Requirements)
data.body:
While I was looking at the `BooleanExpression`/condition code,  I noticed that the **GDI Upgrade Center** accepts two of the same type of upgrade/plug. This forces the **GDI Upgrade Center** to accept only one **Seeker Control** and only one **Ion Cannon Uplink**.

This PR adds the ability to use `ConditionExpression`s for allowing a plug type instead of checking for an existing plug.

## Tests
### Component Tower armament replacement test
This allows replacing the armament of a Component Tower:
```diff
diff --git a/mods/ts/rules/gdi-support.yaml b/mods/ts/rules/gdi-support.yaml
index 31f5c8723e..8c5977ff73 100644
--- a/mods/ts/rules/gdi-support.yaml
+++ b/mods/ts/rules/gdi-support.yaml
@@ -130,6 +130,10 @@ GACTWR:
 			tower.vulcan: tower.vulcan
 			tower.rocket: tower.rocket
 			tower.sam: tower.sam
+		Requirements:
+			tower.vulcan: !tower.vulcan
+			tower.rocket: !tower.rocket
+			tower.sam: !tower.sam
 	ProvidesPrerequisite@buildingname:
 	SelectionDecorations:
 		VisualBounds: 48, 48, 0, -12
```
### Replace with like upgrade for GDI Upgrade Center Test
This tests that the support powers don't reset their timers.
```diff
diff --git a/mods/ts/rules/gdi-structures.yaml b/mods/ts/rules/gdi-structures.yaml
index a27a7c6d71..10370c7c00 100644
--- a/mods/ts/rules/gdi-structures.yaml
+++ b/mods/ts/rules/gdi-structures.yaml
@@ -445,8 +445,8 @@ GAPLUG:
 			plug.ioncannon: plug.ioncannona
 			plug.hunterseeker: plug.hunterseekera
 		Requirements:
-			plug.ioncannon: !plug.ioncannonb && !plug.ioncannona && !plug.hunterseekera
-			plug.hunterseeker: !plug.hunterseekerb && !plug.ioncannona && !plug.hunterseekera
+			plug.ioncannon: !plug.ioncannonb
+			plug.hunterseeker: !plug.hunterseekerb
 	WithIdleOverlay@ioncannona:
 		RequiresCondition: plug.ioncannona
 		Sequence: idle-ioncannona
@@ -459,8 +459,8 @@ GAPLUG:
 			plug.ioncannon: plug.ioncannonb
 			plug.hunterseeker: plug.hunterseekerb
 		Requirements:
-			plug.ioncannon: !plug.ioncannona && !plug.ioncannonb && !plug.hunterseekerb
-			plug.hunterseeker: !plug.hunterseekera && !plug.ioncannonb && !plug.hunterseekerb
+			plug.ioncannon: !plug.ioncannona
+			plug.hunterseeker: !plug.hunterseekera
 	WithIdleOverlay@ioncannonb:
 		RequiresCondition: plug.ioncannonb
 		Sequence: idle-ioncannonb
```

data.title: Quickfix for Trike armament offset
data.body:
Small fix for #12740

Adjusted the x and z offset from the armament, so that it won't damage a wall in the back of the vehicle.
The offsets for the muzzle stayed the same.

|New offset + combat rendering|
|:------:|
|![screenshot - 2017-02-10 - 20 15 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/22840517/1ed22dfe-efce-11e6-8a89-17affe0de2c2.png)|

... the white line in the front of the vehicle is for the gun armament, the line in the back is for the muzzle animation

data.title: [RA] Add/remove official maps.
data.body:
There's quite a few great maps out there that warrants a new map pool overhaul. Before I eventually take steps towards that I just want to quickly add/remove these for our team playing enthusiasts.

**Adding:**

- Countercross (8 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/17651/

**Removing:**

- Blitzkrieg (8 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/12996/
- Hopes Anchor (8 players): http://resource.openra.net/maps/12672/

Hopes Anchor being one-of-a-kind "capture the flag"map in the map pool too often creates confusion as players both new and old often don't know how to approach the game properly, resulting in one-sided matches and general disbelief. Blitzkrieg doesn't seem to go anywhere. Was also suggested for removal last time around.

Countercross is spacious, asymmetric yet fairly balanced and well designed. Seems to produce enjoyable games consistently . 
![countercross](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/22839462/ce85b158-efc9-11e6-95b8-130e08374313.jpg)

- - - - - - -

**Disallow bots:**

- Countercross
- Bombardment Island

data.title: Add Atreides04
HarvesterInsurance: isn't working as in Original
data.body:
It currently makes you get a new harvester if your last one is eaten by a worm and it is available in both Missions and MP/Skirmish.

In orignial it was when last harvester is killed by any means and only was in Missions.

As our worms are way more agressive than original. Current behaviour in MP/Skirmish should stay. But in missions it should be changed to killed any means.
